au.com.codeka.carrot.tag

Class ExtendsTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.codeka.carrot.tag.Tag
      • au.com.codeka.carrot.tag.ExtendsTag

  • public class ExtendsTag
extends Tag
    The "extends" tag is used to base one template off of another one.

    You would make a "skeleton" template like so: 

    
   <html>
     <head>
       <title>Page title</title>
     </head>
     <body>
       {% block "content" %}foo{% end %}
     </body>
   </html>

    And another file to "extend" it, like so: 

    
   {% extends "skeleton.html" %}
   {% block "content" %}
     bar
   {% end %}

    The contents of the second file will then be the contents of the skeleton file, and the "content" block will be replaced with the content inside the block.

    • Method Detail

      • isBlockTag

        public boolean isBlockTag()
        Overrides:
        isBlockTag in class Tag
        Returns:
        True if this is a "block" tag, meaning it contains child content (in the form of a list of Nodes) and false if this is not a block tag (e.g. it's just a single inline element or something).

      • parseStatement

        public void parseStatement(StatementParser stmtParser)
                    throws CarrotException
        Description copied from class: Tag
        Parse the statement that appears after the tag in the markup. This is guaranteed to be called before Tag.isBlockTag() or Tag.canChain(Tag).
        Overrides:
        parseStatement in class Tag
        Parameters:
        stmtParser - A StatementParser for parsing the statement.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - if there is an unrecoverable error parsing the statement.

      • render

        public void render(CarrotEngine engine,
                   java.io.Writer writer,
                   TagNode tagNode,
                   Scope scope)
            throws CarrotException
        Description copied from class: Tag
        Render this Tag to the given Writer.
        Overrides:
        render in class Tag
        Parameters:
        engine - The current CarrotEngine.
        writer - The Writer to render to.
        tagNode - The TagNode that we're enclosed in. You can use this to render the children, or query the children or whatever.
        scope - The current Scope.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - if there's an error parsing or rendering the template
